Description: SABIC Innovative Plastics US LLC, and its subsidiary, SABIC Innovative Plastics Mt. Vernon LLC, agreed to pay an approximately $1 million civil penalty and improve leak detection and repair practices to settle alleged violations of the Clean Air Act (CAA) at chemical manufacturing facilities in Mt. Vernon, Ind., and Burkville, Alabama. Emissions of hazardous air pollutants (HAPs) from leaking equipmentmay cause serious health effects including cancer, reproductive issues and birth defects.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Info Source: Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2003 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.
Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
